channel.title: Got a problem! Items turn into toolkits when die in wildy

item.title: Got a problem! Items turn into toolkits when die in wildy
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Str mage123:

Ok… I will try and post a better post… But the thing is… I dont even know where to look for the coce for this problem… Ive tryed player.java and wilderness.java

Use an IDE. they allow project searching…

Or, alternatively Windows can search Java source files (*.java) in the file search. So you can search the method name directly in the “src” folder of your project. I say the src (source) folder because that will be 1 folder before the project package… Meaning it will search the entire thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Got a problem! Items turn into toolkits when die in wildy
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

  1. Hiding the name of your project ain’t gonna change anything… Especially since I can see the “Where legends are born” text still…

  2. Give us information about what you’re using. See my signature for more info.

  3. What are the contents of the of the method “sendDeath”

item.title: Got a problem! Items turn into toolkits when die in wildy
item.dc:creator: @Str_mage123 Str mage123
item.description:
@Str_mage123 wrote:

Ok, I just started coding so kindoff new to this…
Do you know how to make it keep those 3 most expensive items, and fourth one with protect item?

My senddeath says this…

if (isDead())
		sendDeath(null);
}

Read full topic

item.title: Got a problem! Items turn into toolkits when die in wildy
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Toolkits are item ID 0, meaning there is a flaw in the code giving Item(0, 1) instead of the correct code. Whenever you want help, please make sure to give the code related to the problem so others can fix it for you if you can’t do it yourself.

Read full topic
